Another critical point is the ethical issue of mass medication. Fluoridation adds a pharmaceutical drug to the public water supply without individual consent. You can't control how much you're getting, and you can't opt out easily. This violates basic principles of informed consent and personal autonomy. It's one-size-fits-all medicine, and it doesn’t take into account individual health conditions, genetic differences, or lifestyle factors.

In summary, the risks of fluoride in drinking water—neurotoxicity, overexposure, and ethical concerns—far outweigh the questionable benefits.
